title: How to Get Exp. Share

steps.headline: In Red, Blue, and Yellow, there is no way to get Exp.
steps.description: Share, because Pokémon can't hold items in this generation. In the place of this, there is the Exp. All.

steps.headline: Have at least 50 kinds of Pokémon in your Pokédex.
steps.description: Go to the watch tower east of Fuschia City.

steps.headline: There, talk to Professor Oak's Aide and say you've got 50 kinds of Pokémon.
steps.description: Then, he will give you the Exp. All.

steps.headline: Go to the Lake of Rage, where you find a Red Gyarados.
steps.description: It's a good idea to catch this Pokémon, as it can help you later on in the day and is a great addition to your growing team! However, it's absolutely optional.

steps.headline: If you catch or defeat it, it will drop a Red Scale.
steps.description: If you give that scale to Mr. Pokémon (the guy who gave you the Togepi-egg) he will want to trade that Red Scale for an Exp. Share.

text: Red\/Blue\/Yellow In Red, Blue, and Yellow, there is no way to get Exp. Share, because Pokémon can't hold items in this generation. In the place of this, there is the Exp. All. Have at least 50 kinds of Pokémon in your Pokédex. Go to the watch tower east of Fuschia City. There, talk to Professor Oak's Aide and say you've got 50 kinds of Pokémon. Then, he will give you the Exp. All. Gold\/Silver\/Crystal Go to the Lake of Rage, where you find a Red Gyarados. It's a good idea to catch this Pokémon, as it can help you later on in the day and is a great addition to your growing team! However, it's absolutely optional. If you catch or defeat it, it will drop a Red Scale. If you give that scale to Mr. Pokémon (the guy who gave you the Togepi-egg) he will want to trade that Red Scale for an Exp. Share.
